articles.author: Alexandra Ulmer, Gram Slattery, Nathan Layne
articles.description: Donald Trump's former rivals for the Republican presidential nomination, Nikki Haley and Ron DeSantis, offered full-throated endorsements of his candidacy at the party's convention, in a display of unity days after he survived an assassination attempt.
articles.title: Trump lauded by former rivals Haley, DeSantis in show of unity at Republican convention

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces battled Hamas-led fighters in several areas across Gaza on Tuesday, while Palestinian health officials said at least 13 people were killed in Israeli bombardments in southern and central areas of the enclave.
articles.title: Israeli strikes across Gaza kill at least 13 people, Palestinian health officials say

articles.author: Jason Lange
articles.description: Americans fear their country is spiraling out of control following an assassination attempt on Donald Trump, with worries growing that the Nov. 5 election could spark more political violence, a Reuters/Ipsos poll that closed on Tuesday found.
articles.title: Exclusive: Four in five Americans fear country is sliding into chaos, Reuters/Ipsos poll finds

articles.author: Elizabeth Pineau
articles.description: France's left-wing parties fought bitterly on Tuesday over who to put forward as prime minister, leading Communist party leader Fabien Roussel to warn they were risking a "shipwreck" despite their election success.
articles.title: French left fights over PM role, with current government set to resign

articles.author: Panu Wongcha-Um, Panarat Thepgumpanat
articles.description: Cyanide poisoning was likely the cause of the deaths of six foreigners whose bodies were found in a room in a plush Bangkok hotel, with the suspected killer among the dead, Thai police said on Wednesday
articles.title: Thai police say cyanide killed 6 foreigners in Bangkok hotel, including suspect

articles.author: Michael Martina, David Brunnstrom
articles.description: Donald Trump's choice of populist Ohio Senator J.D. Vance as his vice presidential running mate provides more evidence of what would be a tough U.S. stance on China in a second Trump administration, analysts said.
articles.title: Trump's VP pick Vance points to tough China policy, analysts say

articles.author: Joe Cash
articles.description: China and Russia have begun live-fire naval exercises in the South China Sea, Russian and Chinese state media reported, with the two countries having strengthened military and trade ties in recent years following U.S. sanctions on both.
articles.title: China, Russia kick off live-fire naval exercises in South China Sea

articles.author: Andrew Macaskill
articles.description: Britain's new Prime Minister Keir Starmer will set out his first package of proposed laws on Wednesday, fleshing out how he will honour his election-winning pledge to rebuild the country after years of weak economic growth and political turmoil.
articles.title: New UK government to set out plans in state opening of parliament

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Islamic State claimed responsibility for an attack at a Shi'ite Muslim mosque in Oman, where at least six people, including a policeman, were killed and 28 wounded, in a rare operation in one of the most stable countries in the Middle East, the group said in a statement on Telegram on Tuesday.
articles.title: Islamic State claims responsibility for rare attack at Shi'ite Muslim mosque in Oman

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia and Ukraine are set to exchange 90 prisoners of war on Wednesday in a deal facilitated by the United Arab Emirates, Bloomberg reported, citing a person familiar with the matter.
articles.title: Russia, Ukraine to exchange 90 prisoners of war on Wednesday, Bloomberg reports
